docs.lead_paragraph: One family is at the center of potentially groundbreaking research to see if treatment before dementia can stop Alzheimer’s.

headline.seo: Alzheimer’s Stalks an Extended Family in Colombia
headline.print_headline: A Thief of Memory Stalks a Colombian Family

docs.snippet: One family is at the center of potentially groundbreaking research to see if treatment before dementia can stop Alzheimer’s.

docs.lead_paragraph: YARUMAL, Colombia -- Tucked away on a steep street in this rough-hewn mountain town, an old woman found herself diapering her middle-age children. At frighteningly young ages, in their 40s, four of Laura Cuartas's children began forgetting and falling apart, assaulted by what people here have long called La Bobera, the foolishness. It is a condition attributed, in hushed rumors, to everything from touching a mysterious tree to the revenge of a wronged priest.

headline.main: A Thief of Memory Stalks a Colombian Family

docs.abstract: Article in series The Vanishing Mind, examining worldwide struggle to find answers about Alzheimer's disease; group of 25 families in Colombia shares genetic mutation making them prone to early-onset Alzheimer's; for generations, illness has tormented thousands among sprawling group of relatives, making it world's largest family to experience disease; now, Colombian clan is center stage in potentially groundbreaking assault on disease--attempting to use pre-onset treatment to to preventing Alzheimer's altogether; photos; chart (L)
